snippet: The episode left dozens hospitalized, and officials said they believed the food had been contaminated by cooking oil stored in a container formerly used for insecticides.
abstract: At least 22 children die in Bihar, India, after eating school lunches apparently contaminated by insecticide; episode leaves dozens others hospitalized; officials say they believe cause was cooking oil stored in a container formerly used for insecticides; there is suspicion that some element of cronyism may have helped bring about tragedy.

byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and HARI KUMAR

lead_paragraph: The episode left dozens hospitalized, and officials said they believed the food had been contaminated by cooking oil stored in a container formerly used for insecticides.

headline.main: Contaminated Lunches Kill 22 Children in India
headline.print_headline: Contaminated Lunches Kill 22 Children in India
